page.title: 08Farms and Farming.
page.content: Although many of the farms have now disappeared, farms and farming still thrives. Most of the land around Barnburgh and Harlington is arable land, and the greater part is used for growing cereals, barley, wheat and oil-seed rape. Some potatoes are grown,and a few of the local farmers rent out their land for the growing of peas. A small acreage is devoted to growing strawberries and so attracts visitors to our area. The land is fine agricultural land, and all the farmers have good, modern machinery. Two of the farms support a dairy herd and Mr Richardson of Dovecote Farm supplies the villages daily, as well as transporting quite a large amount of milk to the Wickersley Dairy.
